justification:
In-service failures of first officer’s seat adjustments have resulted in seats becoming detached during
takeoffs and landings. Airworthiness directives (ADs) has been issued requiring inspections and
replacement of seat adjustment components. The AD is comprised of two Service Bulletins (SBs). For
the Horizontal Movement System Inspection and Overhaul, United will comply by removing any of the
affected seats from the aircraft and replacing with a serviceable seat from stock. For the Manual
Override Cable Inspection and Adjustment, United will comply by inspecting and adjusting per the Ipeco
SBs. In order to ensure unmodified seats are not installed on any aircraft, all spare seats will be modified
prior to incorporation of this EA.
instructions_json:
[{"instruction":"
  • Locate Captain's Seat and record the following information. Record Captain's Seat Part Number
  • Record Captain's Seat Serial Number.
","notes":""},{"instruction":"
  • Locate First Officer's Seat and record the following information. Record First Officer's Seat Part Number
  • Record First Officer's Seat Serial Number.
","notes":""},{"instruction":"
  • If the Captain's Seat Part Number is 3A201-0007-01-1 or 3A258-0041-01-1, replace the seat using Steps 2.b and 2.c.
","notes":""}]
